p: Batai virus (BATV), which belongs to the species Batai orthobunyavirus of the genus Orthobunyavirus, has been isolated in Japan and mainland China since 1994 ( 202â€“ 205). BATV is widely distributed in Asia and Europe, and its infection has been observed in cattle, sheep, and goats ( 202, 206, 207). BATV was reported to cause a mild flu-like illness in humans and mild illness among sheep and goats. At present, no affected case associated with BATV has been reported in East Asia. Ngari virus, which is a possible reassortant between Bunyamwera virus and BATV, has been implicated in human hemorrhagic fever in Africa ( 202, 208, 209). In the future, BATV may obtain a higher virulence by genetic reassortment with other related orthobunyaviruses. The potential risk of BATV to public health in East Asia should be considered.
